title: Farms of the future | The importance of #sustainable #farming practices

tasks.task: Understand the advancements in agricultural technology to increase food production.
subtasks: Design robots for autonomous scouting, sensing, and treatment of pests and pathogens.
Use lasers on tractors to detect weeds and apply herbicides or pesticides precisely.
Develop solar-powered prototypes like the Ladybird Rover for autonomous farmer surveillance.
Utilize drones for measuring crop growth, biomass, and detecting stress from pests, nutrients, or water.
Employ multi and hyperspectral cameras for 24/7 data collection.
Implement smartphone apps and cloud services for data gathering, analysis, and action.
Integrate vehicles and equipment using GPS and Wi-Fi for communication and real-time data sharing.
Consider underground farming or integration with factories for efficient resource use.
Use data from large-scale experiments and national centers for plant phenomics.
Address climate change and extreme weather impacts on global food systems through technological advancements.

tasks.task: Highlight the role of the Biotechnology and Biological Sciences Research Council (BBSRC) in agricultural innovation.
subtasks: Acknowledge BBSRC-funded projects such as the Northwick Farm Platform and Scanalyzer.
Collaborate with partners and international researchers to achieve the goal of feeding the growing population.
